name: Disintegrator Ray T-shirt
description:
What's an Aloha Screwdriver show without a little reckless raygun action? Designed (appropriately) by Death Ray Design, this navy blue shirt advertises all the fine features of the Aloha Screwdriver endorsed Disintegrator Ray. 

This is also our first shirt to be available in both a men's and women's fit (we hear you, ladies). Men get a heavy duty Fruit of the Loom 100% cotton, sized up to 3XL. The fairer sex receive an American Apparel poly-cotton shirt that, as we understand it, squeezes in all the right places.

KA-POW!

name: The Haunted Planet (CD & MP3)
description:
This is Aloha Screwdriver's second release and the 11 songs are all gritty instrumentals ranging from hot rod rockabilly to metal-tinged Russian folk songs, space western to haunted mansion.

The recording was captured live to 1-inch analog tape. Careful listening will reveal the occasional grunt or flat note, but you'd be missing the point. This may be the only recording you hear all year that didn't pass through Pro Tools before hitting your ears. This is the unvarnished sound of a real band playing real rock and roll, and it's a rare thing these days.

Purchase includes an emailed link to the album's MP3 files and an EXCLUSIVE full color postcard of the original artwork.

name: Logo t-shirt
description: The Aloha Screwdriver logo, printed big on a black 100% cotton shirt (Fruit of the Loom). For the discerning ladies (or hipster dude) the size small is printed on American Apparel. The rest are Fruit of the Loom, so the quality is nice, but the fit is more forgiving.

name: Album art posters
description: Love our album CD covers? So do we. It's a shame to constrain them to the puny confines of a CD sleeve. You have two to choose from. The artwork for "The Haunted Planet" was created by illustrator Josh Ellingson. It's super awesome, and looks so, so good sized up to 11x17. Full-color on quality 14 pt. gloss cover paper. For our "No Way Out" poster, we went with a 13pt matte cover stock that has the same rough feel as the CD. What you don't get on the CD, though, is all the awesome detail in Peter Kim's original photo. Sized at 12.25x17.25, you can start to appreciate that Cherry Dollface's right arm is really Betty Page, or the spots on the floor that look like a body has been dragged away. This poster includes a white space below used for writing in show dates. These are great posters and they ship rolled in a sturdy cardboard tube. The shipping is kinda pricey compared to our other items, but tubes ain't cheap. Also, because they ship in a tube, we really can't combine shipping with other items.

name: No Way Out (CD)
description:
Here's our CD. It's called No Way Out, named after our song with the same name. We recorded it using an all-analog rig at Little Red Wagon studios, direct to 1-inch analog tape (all courtesy of Brad McGowan).

You get 8 songs. The whole thing clocks in at a little over 20 minutes (yes, we play fast). The disc comes in a gatefold sleeve with a spine. It looks awesome. The model on the cover is the one and only Cherry Dollface. Photo by Peter Kim.
